q: What are the symptoms of oral thrush in adults?
i: Check if it's oral thrush Adults
a: Symptoms of oral thrush in adults include redness inside the mouth with white patches, cracks at the corners of the mouth, difficulty tasting things properly, an unpleasant taste in the mouth, and pain inside the mouth.

q: What are the symptoms of oral thrush in babies?
i: Check if it's oral thrush Babies
a: Symptoms of oral thrush in babies include a white coating on the tongue that cannot be rubbed off easily, white spots in the mouth, and a reluctance to feed.

q: What can cause a white or sore tongue besides oral thrush?
i: If you're not sure it's oral thrush
a: Other causes of a white or sore tongue can include infections, vitamin deficiencies, irritation, or medication side effects.

a: A pharmacist can provide a mouth gel that can be used to treat oral thrush. They can also give advice on its proper usage.

q: When should I see a GP for oral thrush?
a: You should see a GP if your baby is under 4 months old and showing signs of oral thrush, if you have oral thrush and do not see any improvement after 1 week of treatment, or if you experience difficulty or pain when swallowing.

q: How can oral thrush be prevented?
